sub_topic: The Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor dust.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor dust obtained by removing the middle third of a line segment, not once but infinitely many times? Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor dust obtained by removing the middle third of a line segment infinitely many times can be calculated using the formula:

Hausdorff dimension = log(N) / log(r)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and r is the scaling factor.

For the Cantor dust, N = 2 (as two line segments remain after removing the middle third) and the scaling factor r = 3 (as each remaining segment is 1/3 the length of the previous segment).

Hence, the Hausdorff dimension = log(2) / log(3) â‰ˆ 0.63 (rounded to two decimal places).
